full_context: If Ares Management is announced to be or is officially added to S&P 500 in the time period Jan 1, 2026 to March 31, 2026, then the market resolves to Yes.
model_reasoning:
We need probability Ares Management (ARES) is announced/added to S&P 500 during Jan 1–Mar 31, 2026. S&P 500 additions are driven by committee decisions, usually when a constituent is removed (M&A, delisting, bankruptcy) and replaced by an eligible large-cap US company meeting criteria (US company, sufficient market cap, liquidity, float, positive GAAP earnings over last four quarters and most recent quarter, etc.).

ARES is a large, well-known alternative asset manager and (as of recent years) generally has S&P 500-scale market cap. The key uncertainty is eligibility: many alt managers are eligible (e.g., Blackstone is in the S&P 500), so sector isn’t a blocker. If ARES meets profitability and float requirements, it could be a plausible candidate, but additions are competitive (many mega/large caps outside the index), and timing is contingent on a vacancy in that specific quarter.

Base rate: in any given quarter, only a handful of companies are added (often ~5–15 per quarter, varying). The chance any specific “large eligible outsider” gets added in a particular quarter is typically low unless it’s clearly the next-in-line by committee preference. Without a strong prompt that ARES is imminently top of the list (e.g., already widely expected next add), I’d treat it as a modest but not high probability. Also, the window is only 3 months.

So: ARES being added in that narrow Q1 2026 window seems possible but more likely than not to happen either later (after Mar 31) or not at all within the window.

question: Will New Jersey Drone Sightings be confirmed?
full_context: If the New Jersey Drone Sightings is confirmed by any of the Source Agencies after August 12, 2025 and before Jan 1, 2026, then the market resolves to Yes.
model_reasoning:
The question asks whether “New Jersey Drone Sightings” will be “confirmed” by any listed Source Agencies in the window Aug 12, 2025–Jan 1, 2026 (and the market is framed as “In 2025,” so effectively by Dec 31, 2025). 

Key driver is what “confirmed” means in practice: typically an agency confirmation would be an official statement validating that the sightings were indeed drones (as opposed to misidentifications), and/or validating a specific narrative about a coordinated drone event. Historically, bursts of “drone sightings” (e.g., around sensitive sites) often end with partial explanations (hobbyist drones, aircraft, planets, law enforcement activity) and agencies tend to be cautious, sometimes saying they are investigating without confirming. “Confirmed” is a higher bar than “investigated” or “reports received.”

Base rate: Most local drone flap stories do not receive definitive, formal confirmation from major agencies within a few months; where confirmations happen, they’re often limited (e.g., “we recovered a drone” or “it was a lawful operation”), and may not map cleanly to the public narrative of “mystery drones.” Also, the time window is relatively short (~4.5 months remaining in 2025).

On the other hand, if the sightings involve airports/critical infrastructure, there is a non-trivial chance of some official confirmation (FAA/local police/FBI) that at least some incidents were drones, especially if an operator is identified or enforcement action occurs. But without knowing the exact list of “Source Agencies,” I assume it includes federal/state/local authorities; still, “confirmation” as a named event (“New Jersey Drone Sightings”) is less likely than generic statements.

Net: More likely than not that no clear “confirmation” meeting the market’s criteria occurs by end of 2025, but not overwhelmingly so.

question: Will Bitcoin outperform gold in 2025?
full_context: If Bitcoin outperforms gold in 2025, then the market resolves to Yes.
model_reasoning:
Interpretation: “Outperform” most plausibly means total return over calendar year 2025 (price change, ignoring custody costs; gold usually spot USD; BTC usually BTCUSD). As of 2025-11-25, only ~5 weeks remain, so the question is largely about (a) who is currently ahead YTD and (b) whether that lead is likely to flip by year-end.

Base rates/volatility: Bitcoin’s annual volatility is far higher than gold’s. Over a 5-week window, BTC can easily move ±20–40%, while gold typically moves single digits. So even if BTC is currently behind, it has meaningful chance to catch up; if BTC is ahead, it also has non-trivial chance to lose the lead.

Macro/regime: 2025 has been a post-halving year for Bitcoin (halving in 2024), which historically skews positive for BTC relative performance in the following year, though not guaranteed. Gold tends to do best in strong risk-off, high real-rate uncertainty, or geopolitical stress; BTC tends to behave more like a high-beta risk asset, benefiting from liquidity/risk-on.

Time remaining: With limited time left, the probability concentrates around the current YTD leader. Without live price data here, I lean slightly toward BTC outperforming gold in 2025 given (i) typical post-halving dynamics, (ii) BTC’s higher expected return in risk-on environments, and (iii) its ability to make up gaps quickly. But I keep confidence moderate because (a) gold can surge on geopolitical surprises and (b) BTC can correct sharply into year-end.
